result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  Payment plan in amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 7/1/2016 and additional payments due the first of each month thereafter.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Straight time.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Theodore Willis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court ordered defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME. 

Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 7/1/2016 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Court objects to electronic monitoring. 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D287A
cf
Jury List, received and filed.
Waiver Right to Testify, received and filed.
Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Verdict, received and filed.
Exhibit List, received and filed.

Defendant Theodore Willis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Pre-trial discussions placed on the record.

Jury in the box at the hour of 10:08.

Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Detective Nick Stachula. 

Exhibit 4 received.  

State rests.  

Jury out of box at 10:30.  

Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  

Colloquy between court and defendant regarding defendant's right to testify.

Jury in the box at 10:40.  

Sworn for defense: Jennifer Spivey.

Exhibit 5 received.

State and defense rest.  

Testimony closed.  

Jury out of the box at 10:55.

Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  

Discussions regarding jury instructions placed on the record.

Exhibit 6 received.

Jury in the box at 11:15

Court instructed jury.  

Closing arguments by state and defense.  

Court charged the jury.  

Alternate juror selected (13) by lot and released.  

Jury retired at the hour of 11:40 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Do and Huling who were duly sworn for that purpose. 

At the hour of 11:50 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  

Court polled and discharged the jury.  

Verdict received and filed.  

Court granted defense motion for judgment on the verdict and denied states motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  

Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.


Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment

Defendant Theodore Willis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.   

Jury panel in court.  

Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 2:47.  

Jury out of the box at 3:55.

Sidebars placed on the record.

Jury back in the box at 4:15.

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  

Jury list received and filed. 

Court instructed jury.  

Opening statements by state and defense.  

Trial proceeded.  

Stipulation placed on the record.

Exhibit 3 received.

Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Officer Stephen Heckler. 

Exhibits 1-2 received.  

At the hour of 4:45 jury was excused for the evening and ordered to return on 4/19/2016 at 9:00 a.m.

Sidebar placed on the record.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Case passed. Case recalled. Court orders Plea questionnaire withdrawn.

Defendant Theodore Willis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial and motion hearing. 

Case hears motion hearing.  

Court ordered witnesses sequestered. 

Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Detective Nick Stachula. 

Colloquy between court and defendant regarding defendant's right to testify.

Sworn for the defense: Theodore Willis.
 
Arguments heard.  

For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion.

Defendant Theodore Willis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  State puts offer on the record.  Defendant rejects offer.  Matter to remain on for Jury Trial.  Goodchild Hearing will be heard on the day of trial.
Letter from girlfriend of defendant re:  dismissal of case.
DEFENSE DEMAND FOR GOODCHILD HEARING: ISSUE KNOWING AND VOLUNTARY NATURE OF WAIVER, RECEIVED AND FILED
STATE'S WITNESS LIST, FILED

Defendant Theodore Willis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sargent just appointed to the case.  Court allowed Attorney Pecora to withdraw on January 6, 2016.   Parties request this matter be scheduled for Jury Trial and Final Pretrial.  Defense informed the Court that he may be filing a Miranda/Goodchild motion.  Defendant must file this motion by February 29, 2016.   Witness lists and motions in limine to be filed before the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Theodore Willis in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Thomas Potter for the State of Wisconsin.
